subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Voice inflections?
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0245_01CA36E6.92A14160
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Oh yeah-sure....if it is for someone else, no harm in delivering it. Then b=
oth of you can see what comes of it.

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  Fro=
m: Misty Dawn 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, September =
16, 2009 3:51 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Voice inflections?


    Yep =
thats pretty much how it goes unless they press me to share it with who the=
 message is for and even then the timing has to be right. May be then, may =
be a year later but the messages always get thru to who they are meant to.
=

        Misty

        --- On Wed, 9/16/09, April Abercrombie <april@aberc=
rombieghostresearch.com> wrote:


          From: April Abercrombie <april@=
abercrombieghostresearch.com>
          Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Voice in=
flections?
          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
          Date: Wednesday,=
 September 16, 2009, 5:44 PM


            
          As far as I am concer=
ned, for what it is worth-you seem to be going about it the right way. As l=
ong as you remain open mindedly skeptical about any knew info, just as you =
did with the messages that were for you, there is no problem with it at all=
, IMO.

          It sounds like you don't discount it and you don't buy in=
to it, you just file it away to see what comes of it later.

          Perf=
ect :)

            ----- Original Message ----- 
            From: Misty D=
awn 
            To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
            Sent: Wednesday,=
 September 16, 2009 3:30 PM
            Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Voice in=
flections?


              
                  There is no doubt in my mind =
about that. You are right April =3D) In the beginning I did seek some proof=
 for my own sanity. But time and time again I have learned much more than I=
 ever expected to. For me its become more than about contact with my dead l=
oved ones, its more about learning and growing from the experiences. That d=
efinitely has been the end result. 

                  Misty

             =
     --- On Wed, 9/16/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearc=
h. com> wrote:


                    From: April Abercrombie <april@abercro=
mbiegh ostresearch. com>
                    Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Voi=
ce inflections?
                    To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
          =
          Date: Wednesday, September 16, 2009, 5:14 PM


                  =
    
                    I would definitely call that proof. The strength o=
f the proof is in the part that you knew nothing about what the message wou=
ld mean to the person, or if it a message for you, it was some fact that yo=
u had not known prior.

                    IMO, in this case there is no w=
ay it would be a case matrixing or hearing what you wanted or expected to h=
ear, that it was real information conveyed through an intelligent source.

=
                      ----- Original Message ----- 
                      F=
rom: bulletbabea 
                      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
     =
                 Sent: Wednesday, September 16, 2009 2:46 PM
              =
        Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Voice inflections?


                       =
 
                      I think quite often when the message isn't for me a=
nd it's for someone outside of this research it matters very much that the =
message is something I myself would never know. It hits home so much more f=
or the recipient. To me it may seem dumb or meaningless but to the person w=
ho the message is for it can have a deeper impact because they know theres =
no way possible I could know the info. And vice versa when the message is f=
or me sometimes the info doesnt become clear til much later down the road w=
hen I learn that bit of info or watch that predictive message become realit=
y. It's all very interesting and educational =3D)

                      Mi=
sty

                      --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com, "April Abercrom=
bie" <april@...> wrote:
                      >
                      > The=
 only way to prove 100% that something you receive through the box is authe=
ntic communication, is if they say something that you can verify, something=
 you yourself did not know.
                      > 
                      =
> ----- Original Message ----- 
                      > From: Misty Dawn 
 =
                     > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
                      =
> Sent: Wednesday, September 16, 2009 3:41 AM
                      > Subje=
ct: Re: [EVP-ITC] Voice inflections?
                      > 
             =
         > 
                      > I have gotten many life like voices ove=
r the years. My first evp was my mothers voice and no boxes were involved. =
The box is a tool/method and there are many ways to get their voices heard.=
 So in the different methods I have used, yes I have heard voices that rese=
mble their lifetime charachteristics and tones. Is it always that way? No. =

                      > 
                      > Most often the group will=
 speak as one voice because I have requested they do so. One voice tone wil=
l begin a sentence and another will end it. So I may hear my female friends=
 voice start off a thought and an unknown male voice finish the sentence. A=
nd vice versa often they speak in tones which do not even come close to wha=
t they sounded like in life. Quite often they are spirits I didnt know in l=
ife. I may get someone saying This is edison, and then find an old recordin=
g he did where he starts it off saying This is edison, but for me I do not =
know the man so there is no recognition for me. I document it and file it a=
way as a curiousity.
                      > 
                      > I alw=
ays laugh when people say thats not your mother or friend thats something t=
rying to fool you and mess with your head. I knew my mother longer than any=
one and its interesting that it is easier for those people to believe that =
its possible that something/someone else is speaking pretending to be my mo=
ther but its much harder for them to believe that quite possibly that reall=
y is my mother keeping her promise to stay in touch after death. If one is =
possible then so is the other. I tend to be stubborn in some respects in th=
at I dont instantly believe what anyone tells me whether living or not. If =
they give me a message I think is dumb I am very reluctant to pass it on an=
d usually those are the ones that get the biggest confirmations tho it mean=
s nothing to me at the time. So yes quite possibly evp work can be used the=
 same as mediumship in missing persons cases.
                      > 
    =
                  > For me tone of voice has grown to mean nothing. It is a=
 treat when they manage to come across sounding as they did when in physica=
l form here but I look beyond the tone of voice. Often people get a childs =
voice and they become saddened by the thought that a child is earthbound. B=
ut I see it just as a representation of voice and whether it comes across a=
s male female child or robot matters little to me.
                      > =

                      > I do find they often resume the "character" they p=
layed because after all that is sort of what we are, characters in some gia=
nt play. Whether it is the beliefs they had which were their trademark, the=
 tone of voice, their image, or use of some nickname even I dont know about=
 I look at it all as just a pixel in a larger portrait that some part survi=
ves once the body has ceased to function. And the message is simply, our en=
ergy continues on.
                      > 
                      > Quote b=
y Einstein: 'Energy cannot be created or destroyed, it can only be changed =
from one form to another.'
                      > 
                      >=
 Misty (the insomniac is up way tooooo late and rambling on LOL)
          =
            > 
                      > --- On Tue, 9/15/09, mrscaptainjack2=
 <jjkamp@...> wrote:
                      > 
                      > 
    =
                  > From: mrscaptainjack2 <jjkamp@...>
                    =
  > Subject: [EVP-ITC] Voice inflections?
                      > To: EVP-I=
TC@yahoogroups .com
                      > Date: Tuesday, September 15, 20=
09, 9:56 PM
                      > 
                      > 
             =
         > 
                      > I was googling about AM radio reception=
, and I came across the below exchange on a forum. It talks about using the=
 box to find missing persons (which I didn't know was possible), and the co=
nversation mentions hearing specific voice inflections and recognizing a de=
ad person's specific voice on the box. My question is, do any of you get a =
recognizable voice? The voices I get always sound robotic, although I do ge=
t clearly male or female voices. 
                      > 
                =
      > http://www.itcbridg e.com/forum/ view_topic. php?id=3D515& forum_id=
=3D 31
                      >
